details:
@ mentions in AI chat

Type @ to mention specific items in the sheet. This helps the AI understand your intent and references.

Schema viewer

We've improved the schema viewing experience, adding it additionally to the AI chat any time a connection is opened. Browse your database schema while you seamlessly chat with your data.

Formula ranges

Instead of writing Formulas one cell at a time, AI can now insert ranges of Formulas to the sheet, enabling a much more efficient formula writing experience.

Bug fixes

We shipped numerous bug fixes and stability improvements in October.

  • Column grid lines missing
  • Disable negative grid headings
  • Limit sheet name length

View the complete list of features and bug fixes from October on GitHub here.

AI Chat

AI Chat lets you chat directly with your data and code in Quadratic spreadsheets. Creating business analytics just got super easy. With Quadratic AI, you can build charts and find insights from your data faster than ever.

AI code editor improvements

With the AI Assistant in the code editor, you can chat directly with your code. Write and edit Python, SQL, JavaScript, or formulas.

AI supports various models and scenarios

Quadratic AI supports a variety of models, including OpenAI and Anthropic models. You can use Anthropic models either directly from their cloud or via the models hosted on a Quadratic instance on AWS Bedrock.

You can also contact us for help with custom models in self-hosted Quadratic instances.

Numerous minor improvements and fixes

  • Dashboard design tweaks for readability
  • Improved new file dialogue
  • Design tweak for AI fix button
  • Hyperlink fix with colons
  • Error triangle disappearing immediately when fixed
  • Data validation centering fix
  • Dark mode fixes
  • Drag and move code cells duplication fix
  • Memory leak fix for better performance
  • Unfollowing from grid fix
  • Custom dates bug fix
  • Plotly chart speed up via CDN
  • Request proxy fix
  • Code cell artifact bug fix
  • Send new users straight to a file

New AI Models

Default: On Default, you'll notice a faster, more powerful experience. We are continually shipping improvements to our Default model to ensure a healthy balance of cost and performance for new users.

Max: On Max, we continuously upgrade to the model that performs best on our evaluations. The latest release from Anthropic, Claude Sonnet 4.5, delivers performance comparable to GPT-5 but with significantly faster speed. As a result, we've switched the model on Max from GPT-5 to Claude Sonnet 4.5 for our power users to get the best possible experience.

Semantic layer

Have specific quirks about your database you want AI to know about? Anything you enter in the semantic layer field of your connection details will be included in the AI's context.

SQL in left chat

You can now query your connections directly from the left-side AI chat. Previously, this could only be done from the code editor chat, with limited scope. Now, you can run fully agentic SQL queries from the left chat to query your database and immediately start analysis.

We will also be following up soon with lots of improvements to this experience, including better ways to view schema, narrow chat context, and more.

Bug fixes

We shipped numerous bug fixes and stability improvements in September. Some of these fixes include:

  • Remove letters from autocomplete
  • Copy as PNG closes context menu
  • Calendar properly showing for datetimes

View the complete list of features and bug fixes shipped from September on GitHub here.

Theming

Theming in Quadratic allows you to utilize the world's first dark mode spreadsheet and pick from a palette of pre-set accent colors.

Clickable links

You can now create clickable URLs in your spreadsheets that, when clicked, will open in a new browser tab.

Insert/delete columns and rows

You can now insert and delete single or multiple columns and rows.

Smart autocomplete

Smart autocomplete automatically suggests autocomplete options, using the content from adjacent cells to make recommendations. To fill in the recommended text, press the tab button.

Date & time formulas

We've added support for date and time formulas, allowing you to easily create and manipulate dates and times.

Numerous minor improvements and fixes

  • Reduce percentage decimal precision
  • Changing sheet saves input
  • Ctrl + ; inserts current time
  • Focus returns to grid when pressing esc on menus
  • Fix MATCH formula
  • Fix sheet drag locations in bottom bar
  • Fix auto-resize row bug and offsets
  • Change default AI model and tune temperature
  • Chart resizing fixes
  • Border menu improvements
  • Update code cells on undo/redo
  • Fix border clearing
  • New design for multiplayer avatars
  • Fix sheets stuck in pan mode
  • Keep go-to menu open when pressing Shift
  • Fix border formatting
  • Prevent paste on middle click on Linux
  • CSV delimiter improvements
  • Show logged-in user context when you don't have permissions on a file

changes: New tools and context for AI
details:
New tools and context for AI

We added many new tools for AI to access, including:

  • Insert/delete rows/columns
  • Table manipulation
  • Validations
  • Many more

AI should now have nearly complete access to common spreadsheet features. We also significantly improved AI context, with simpler and more comprehensive instructions.

Read about the full scope of our recent AI changes here in our Blog.

Broader Excel import formatting support

Until now, Excel imports only added data and formula to the sheet. Now we also support formatting on imports, including:

  • Font: bold, italic, underline, strikethrough, color
  • Background/fill color
  • Alignment: horizontal, vertical, wrap text, shrink to fit
  • Date, time, datetime
  • Number: commas, decimals, scientific, percentage, currency, exponent
  • Border: border style, border color
  • Layout: column width, row height

SQL schema filtering

One of our most active business users requested SQL schema filtering. We built and shipped the feature same-day. Have a feature you want built? Please let us know.

Bug fixes

We shipped a few minor bug fixes and stability improvements in August.

View the complete list of features and bug fixes from August on GitHub here.
